item.title: Now Accepting Spring Applications for CSTEP!
item.description: The Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program (CSTEP) is excited to announce that applications for the Spring semester are now open! CSTEP is an academic enrichment program designed to support New York State residents who are economically disadvantaged and pursuing careers in STEM or health-related fields.

item.title: Webex Application Training Session on Friday January 23, 2026
item.description: Join us on Friday, January 23, from 11am-12pm for a hands-on Webex Training Session, part of the MMS Collaboration Software Training series. This session focuses on the Webex application and its integration with Outlook and Blackboard, so you can efficiently schedule, launch, and manage meetings directly from the tools you use every day. Register now: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700

item.title: Beyond the Classroom with Andrew Morrison ’87: Preparing for Industry, Innovation, and Impact
item.description: Sunday, February 1st, 5 p.m. - 9 p.m., Andrew Morrison, former President of the RPI Student Union and serial entrepreneur who has built multiple million-dollar companies, will offer winning strategies to the RPI community. Implement these strategies in a workshop that will help you make a professional brand, attract a dream career, or launch a business. Dinner will be served. You’ll acquire access to $25,000 in travel scholarships, secrets to securing positions, and pathways to RPI resources.
item.author: Community

item.title: Radical Imagination: Person-Centric Approaches to Music Making
item.description: Prize-winning composer, improviser, and multi-instrumentalist Nick Dunston brings his multiple musical talents to RPI on January 22 with a presentation on “Radical Imagination,” drawing on his prolific body of work spanning jazz, electro-acoustics, and sound art. Dunston views improvisation not merely as a skill, but as a practice that fundamentally shapes the artists who engage in it. Join at 7pm at West Hall 326.
